intro: Arctopoa, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its silvery or grayish foliage, which gives it its common name. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Arctopoa species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and sometimes for their medicinal properties.
